question: Krukenberg tumour is most commonly from:
exp: Ans: c (Stomach) Ref: Shaw, 13th ed, p. 401. Krukenberg ovarian tumours. Primary sites - Stomach (70%), Breast (6%), Colon (15%). Involvement of ovary by - Retrograde lymphatics. Always bilateral with smooth surface. Maintaining the shape of ovary. No tendency of adhesion (i. e. capsule remain intact). Histology: Signet ring cells. BRIDGE: signet ring cells are seen in Krukenberg tumour but sideroblasts are seen in v myelodysplatic syndrome.
